solution_line_template: His square paintings take up {area_square_painting_each} square feet each because {square_painting_side} x {square_painting_side} = <<{square_painting_side}*{square_painting_side}={area_square_painting_each}>>{area_square_painting_each}

His small paintings take {area_small_painting_each} square feet each because {small_painting_length} x {small_painting_width} = <<{small_painting_length}*{small_painting_width}={area_small_painting_each}>>{area_small_painting_each}

His large painting takes up {area_large_painting_each} square feet because {large_painting_length} x {large_painting_width} = <<{large_painting_length}*{large_painting_width}={area_large_painting_each}>>{area_large_painting_each}.

Combined, his square paintings take up {total_area_square_paintings} square feet because {num_square_paintings} x {area_square_painting_each} = <<{num_square_paintings}*{area_square_painting_each}={total_area_square_paintings}>>{total_area_square_paintings}

Combined, his small paintings take up {total_area_small_paintings} square feet because {num_small_paintings} x {area_small_painting_each} = <<{num_small_paintings}*{area_small_painting_each}={total_area_small_paintings}>>{total_area_small_paintings}

In total, his paintings take up {total_collection_area} square feet because {area_large_painting_each} + {total_area_square_paintings} + {total_area_small_paintings} = <<{area_large_painting_each}+{total_area_square_paintings}+{total_area_small_paintings}={total_collection_area}>>{total_collection_area}
